item.title: regular registration
item.description: Reunions runs from Thursday, May 22 - Sunday, May 25, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Reunions runs from Thursday, May 22 - Sunday, May 25, 2025.

What‚Äôs Included:

  • All meals are included in registration.
  • All participants will receive a T-shirt, and each classmate will receive a canvas tote bag, bandana, and a commemorative pin.
  • Additional swag (fabric, hats, umbrellas, etc.) will be available for purchase at the class reunions store through the year.

Notes:

  • Jackets orders are now closed, but will re-open after Reunions here.
  • Some swag may not be available for late registrants.

Check-in hours are at our 25th Reunion HQ in the Whitman College upper courtyard.

Hours

  • Thursday: Noon ‚Äì 11:00 pm
  • Friday: 9:00 am ‚Äì Midnight
  • Saturday: 9:00 am ‚Äì Midnight

Questions? Please email the Registration Chair.

item.title: registration_week
item.description: Hello 2000, and welcome to WhatsApp! I am thrilled to announce that thanks to the incredible work of your Reunions Committee, we are ahead of schedule, and started beta testing registration on Thursday! I wanted to give you all a rundown so you know what to expect this week.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Hello 2000, and welcome to WhatsApp! I am thrilled to announce that thanks to the incredible work of your Reunions Committee, we are ahead of schedule, and started beta testing registration on Thursday! I wanted to give you all a rundown so you know what to expect this week.

We‚Äôd love some additional testing from this group, particularly those of you who are international. Don‚Äôt worry, even if you don‚Äôt know exactly who‚Äôs going to be in your group, you can edit your registration later. If you‚Äôre interested, we can take 20-30 people tomorrow. Just message me here, and I‚Äôll pass along the link.

Depending on feedback, we‚Äôll open registration to this group on Wednesday or Thursday.

Friday, we‚Äôll send a class-wide email with the theme and jacket design and open up registration.

One very important point is that registration is separate from your class jacket order. Registration runs until May, but with the lead times we need for the jacket, your jacket order must be in by DECEMBER 13, 2024. That is very, very soon. The jacket team made an awesome sizing chart that you can find here: You can print it out and take it to a tailor or have a friend help. It‚Äôs quick, but it does appear to best be done as a two-person job.

item.title: jacket_update_2
item.description: Hey team ‚Äì¬†I could say this is the last warning, but we all know you‚Äôre getting another notice Friday. With the lead time required to actually manufacture our jackets, we need your order in by THIS FRIDAY, DECEMBER 13, or you won‚Äôt have one for Reunions. We‚Äôve had a great response from you all so far, but want to get the message out far and wide, so that you‚Äôre looking your best at Reunions this year. Get your order in, ASAP, and check in with your friends to make sure they get theirs ordered as well!
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Hey team ‚Äì¬†I could say this is the last warning, but we all know you‚Äôre getting another notice Friday. With the lead time required to actually manufacture our jackets, we need your order in by THIS FRIDAY, DECEMBER 13, or you won‚Äôt have one for Reunions. We‚Äôve had a great response from you all so far, but want to get the message out far and wide, so that you‚Äôre looking your best at Reunions this year. Get your order in, ASAP, and check in with your friends to make sure they get theirs ordered as well!

WhatsApp Group

We‚Äôve mentioned this quite a bit, but email deliverability is‚Ä¶not great. Hopefully, you‚Äôve updated your address in TigerNet, but if you want to make sure you are up-to-date on what‚Äôs going on with Reunions, join our WhatsApp group. It is not a group chat, and we promise not to spam you‚Ä¶it‚Äôs just a one-way channel for important announcements to ensure you don‚Äôt miss anything. That said, please forward this to your friends, and make sure they know how to stay in touch!

Registration Update

Thrilled to say we‚Äôre closing in on 700 registrations for our Reunion so far! Over the last couple of days, we‚Äôve had calls with the beverage, entertainment, and children‚Äôs committees, and we are going to have some very exciting news to share over the next few weeks. If you‚Äôve registered already, get excited! If you‚Äôre not‚Ä¶what are you waiting for? Register now, and we‚Äôll see you in May!

item.title: housing_update
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Class Survey

We have a quick survey for you to help with logistics and orders around Reunions next year. We want to get a sense of the who, where, when, and how (we‚Äôre pretty clear on the what and why). If you have plans, let us know them. If you don‚Äôt have plans, let‚Äôs start the conversation!TAKE THE SURVEY

HOUSING UPDATE

Hey gang, wanted to get to you all with an update on housing, mostly because Nassau Inn kicks off the frenzy by opening up their reservation window tomorrow (Weds) at 10am ET.

With the demands of Reunions, housing is a mix of on-campus housing, local hotels, and room available through friendly institutions (e.g. Rider University), not to mention Airbnbs and short-term rentals like that. Here‚Äôs a quick overview.

On-Campus Housing

The University administers on-campus housing, which you can sign up for when you register for Reunions. It‚Äôs not 100% guaranteed ‚Äì it depends on how many undergrads stay on campus through Reunions ‚Äì but it is pretty reliably available for major reunions like ours. It is definitely the cheapest option, typically about $150 for a bed for the weekend, but 1) it can be anywhere on campus (potentially without AC), 2) you‚Äôll have a shared bathroom, and 3) you‚Äôll need to provide your own linens (This may be less of an issue as the ‚Äò99s found a rental service to take care of this. We‚Äôll probably use it, but we still need to set that up). Also, the University tries to keep all members of a party together, but can‚Äôt promise it.

Local Hotels

We have currently reserved about 210 rooms across 11 hotels in the area. Most of them were on this year‚Äôs Reunions shuttle bus route to and from campus, and most are along Route 1. We‚Äôre still gathering booking links to make those reservations, but rates are coming in between $290 and $550 a night, and we have a good mix of bed/occupancy types. We have a list of local hotels here. We note where we have a group rate, and list the mix of what‚Äôs available. Most of the hotels in the area are opening reservations over the next month or so, so this is a living document. The two hotels right downtown, open booking tomorrow. Expect the Nassau Inn to sell out in a couple of hours. The Graduate Hotel is new to the area, and just opened on Nassau Street across from the Rocky dining hall. We‚Äôve been talking to them for 14 months off and on about room blocks, and, well‚Ä¶we wish them and their proposed room rates all the success in the world.

Friendlies

We‚Äôre still reaching out to the local institutions - Rider College, Westminster Choir College, and Princeton Theological Seminary. They tend to open up later on in the process. Based on the ‚Äô99s experience this year, the pricing is a little more than on campus, but they have AC, linens are included, and are on the shuttle route, so a decent value overall.

Airbnb, Vrbo etc.

A lot of locals are willing to rent their homes out during Reunions, even some otherwise loyal alumni during an off-year (We missed you this year, Ann!). That inventory can certainly vary and outside of the committee‚Äôs domain, but it‚Äôs worth checking out as well.

item.title: registration_kickoff
item.description: Aughty Aught! Aughty Aught! Aughty Aught!
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Aughty Aught! Aughty Aught! Aughty Aught!

Your Reunions Committee is thrilled to announce that registration is now open for Reunions 2025! Head on over to reunions.princeton2000.org to register, learn more about our theme, ‚ÄúBid Every Care Withdraw‚Äù and check out our amazing class jacket!

Early Bird Registration

I want to encourage you to register early if you can. I know we‚Äôve said this before, but the more certainty we have around attendance, the more we can commit to making sure you and your guests have a great time. For example, entertainment gets booked pretty far out in advance. If it‚Äôs January and we can only afford some dude with an iPod, even if we get a bunch of money in April, the upgrade options just aren‚Äôt there. Now, we‚Äôll still have a great time, but if you‚Äôre pretty sure you‚Äôre coming, commit!

Class Jacket ‚Äì DECEMBER 13

This is CRITICALLY IMPORTANT. With the lead time required to actually manufacture our jackets, we need your order in by DECEMBER 13. That said, you‚Äôre going to want to run to order this thing anyway! The costumes committee NAILED IT. It‚Äôs an elegant, timeless design, with several thoughtful details, and, get this, a lightweight fabric that was custom-designed for Reunions. Seriously, check it out! Get your sizing right and get your order in. You‚Äôre going to look great!

WhatsApp Group

We‚Äôve mentioned this quite a bit, but email deliverability is‚Ä¶not great. Hopefully, you‚Äôve updated your address in TigerNet, but if you want to make sure you are up-to-date on what‚Äôs going on with Reunions, join our WhatsApp group. It is not a group chat, and we promise not to spam you‚Ä¶it‚Äôs just a one-way channel for important announcements to ensure you don‚Äôt miss anything. That said, please forward this to your friends, and make sure they know how to stay in touch!

REGISTER NOW

Join our WhatsApp group and stay connected

Registration Update

We‚Äôve got over 550 people registered for our Reunion so far, and that is AWESOME. We‚Äôre well ahead of pace, and all indications suggest we‚Äôve got a barn-burner ahead of us. If you‚Äôve registered already, get excited! If you‚Äôre not‚Ä¶what are you waiting for? Register now, and we‚Äôll see you in May!

item.title: theme_poll
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Dear ‚Äò00 Classmates,

Our 25th Reunion is now less than a year away, and your volunteer organizers are in high gear selecting a theme and design elements. The purpose of this message is (1) to provide an update on theme and jacket planning, and (2) to invite you to provide feedback on ideas.

25th Reunion Costume

As you may recall from Reunions, the centerpiece of the 25th will be a new Reunions jacket. This blazer is a more formal upgrade from the beer jacket we received at graduation, and classmates typically continue to wear their 25th blazers at future Reunions and other alumni events. There will be other pieces to our 25th Reunion look, please stay tuned!

The blazer will be a separate purchase from your registration fee, and classmates will be given the opportunity to order 25th blazers whether or not they are able to attend the 25th in person. You‚Äôll hear from us in the fall about ordering and sizing details.

25th Reunion Theme

After having our 20th canceled due to COVID, classmate feedback ahead of our 25th is clear: We are hearing that you want ‚Äúhigh attendance,‚Äù ‚Äúbroad participation,‚Äù and ‚Äúto focus on being together.‚Äù Your Reunions volunteers ‚Äì more than 30 strong so far ‚Äì fully agree!

We have also been told by some of you that the overall feel of our Reunion is more important than the specific theme, and we have heard words like ‚Äúclassic,‚Äù ‚Äúfun,‚Äù ‚Äúclassy,‚Äù and ‚Äúgood looking jacket.‚Äù

Taking into account theme suggestions from classmates, general concepts informed by previous classes‚Äô 25th experience, and University guidelines for Reunions themes, the relevant committees have met several times to brainstorm and develop workable ideas for our 25th Reunion theme. And now we are ready to hear from you once again‚Ä¶

Give us your feedback!

item.title: classLetter0824
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Dear Classmate,

Yes!

Sorry, I had to try that out‚Ä¶what a thrill! Hope you felt it too. Really, this letter is meant to catch you up with what‚Äôs going on with your dear Class of 2000 as we gear up for our 25th Reunion, May 22-25, 2025. Email has been unreliable, so we‚Äôre going old school to make sure you have the most important information now and know how to stay in touch through the year.

There are three things to remember:

‚Ä¢ reunions.princeton2000.org is the source of truth

‚Ä¢ Registration opens November 1

‚Ä¢ Please join our WhatsApp broadcast channel here:

Reunions Site ‚Äì reunions.princeton2000.org

The most important thing to remember is reunions.princeton2000.org. That is the source of truth for all Reunions information going forward. The site has information on housing, schedule, kids‚Äô activities, and frequently asked questions. Some things, like the schedule, are still developing, so check for updates throughout the year.

Registration ‚Äì November 1

Our 25th Reunion will be May 22-25, 2025. That is the most important date on your calendar going forward. Just make sure you‚Äôre in Princeton those days, and everything else will pretty much work out for you. That said, the second-most important date is November 1, 2024, when we open registration.

Anyway, you can go to reunions.princeton2000.org on November 1. We‚Äôd really appreciate it if you can register early. The more certainty we have around attendance, the more budget we can commit to our entertainment, food, and beverages. You know you‚Äôre coming to Reunions (we all know you‚Äôre coming to Reunions)‚Ä¶so register early!

Communications ‚Äì join our WhatsApp

It seems that only about 60% of you are receiving our emails, and it‚Äôs a different 60% each time. If you haven‚Äôt received our emails, I‚Äôm really sorry about that. We‚Äôre trying to address it in three ways.

First, if you set up forwarding to your real email years ago via an @alumni address, that‚Äôs a source of a lot of our problems. Best to go to Tigernet and update the directory to reflect your actual email account.

Second, while emails from Tigernet don‚Äôt seem to deliver, emails from a personal account seem to arrive simply fine. I‚Äôm happy to send them again to you on the side. Just drop me an email at jpurnell@alumni and I‚Äôll put you on my list.

Third, we‚Äôve set up a channel on WhatsApp that will be used for official class announcements. It is not a group chat, just a way for us to broadcast out key information. As a side benefit, it will allow us to get information out quickly during Reunions if we need to adjust anything on the fly. Please visit https://bit.ly/P2000Announcements to join.

Recap

‚Ä¢ Right now: https://bit.ly/P2000Announcements.

‚Ä¢ November 1: Registration: reunions.princeton2000.org.

‚Ä¢ May 22-25: You, Reunions, Princeton.

Tiger, Tiger Tiger,

Justin

P.S. you look great, everybody loves you, and we all simply can‚Äôt wait to see you at Reunions.

item.title: early_registration_last_call
item.description: Hey gang ‚Äì Wishing everyone a very Happy New Year! Hope you‚Äôre excited for May‚Ä¶about an hour ago, we passed 500 classmates and 1,100 total registrations for Reunions!
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Hey gang ‚Äì Wishing everyone a very Happy New Year! Hope you‚Äôre excited for May‚Ä¶about an hour ago, we passed 500 classmates and 1,100 total registrations for Reunions!

Still have a few hours to get it done:

https://princeton.reunioniq.com/go/2025/2000

item.title: time_to_roar
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Reunions 2024 ‚Äì History!

Reunions 2024‚Ä¶in a books and a major success! Congratulations to the ‚Äò99s on an excellent weekend. But as we all know‚Ä¶it was but a prelude. We‚Äôre up! Reunions 2025 runs from Thursday, May 22 through Saturday, May 24th. Mark your calendars! We‚Äôll have a steady drumbeat of information starting this summer as we run up to the big date, but one thing I know people are wondering about is housing. We‚Äôre getting blocks at most hotels at every price point, but one hotel that doesn‚Äôt do blocks for Reunions is the Nassau Inn. If you‚Äôre hoping to stay there, the Nassau Inn starts booking for Reunions 2025 on Wednesday, July 10, at 10am Eastern Time. I think the rooms go very very quickly, so be at the ready.

Reunions Committee Volunteering

If you got the Reunions bug this weekend and want to make things happen for the class, the door is always open to volunteers. Send me an email, and fill out this google form so we know how to contact you!

üêÖüêÖüêÖ

item.title: dues
item.description: What Are Class Dues and Why Are They Important?
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
• What Are Class Dues and Why Are They Important?
  • Goals for Class Dues
  • Dues Payers Receive Priority for On-campus Reunions Housing Deadline: December 15

As we ramp up for our 25th, we would like to enlist your support to keep our class finances strong and fund programs & events as we head into Reunions and beyond. Our class dues participation rates have been dropping over the last few years so we wanted to take a moment to explain why we collect dues and what exactly these funds go to support. Class dues cycle on a fiscal year basis (i.e., July 1 ‚Äì June 30) and fund the obligations of the class and are separate from Annual Giving, which supports the University. Each year these expenses include:

  • Princeton Alumni Council (ALCO) Dues: Each class pays dues to the Alumni Council to fund its operations. ALCO is the official connector of the Alumni Community with the University and organizes all the amazing alumni events you‚Äôve attended including Reunions, Alumni Day, and the highly-successful conferences such as She Roars and ¬°Adelante Tigres!. In addition, ALCO connects regional associations and supports class operations.
  • Technology, Printing and Mailing: As you might imagine, there are costs associated with maintaining the website and putting together communications to the class. While not substantial, these costs are recurring.
  • Class Events and Community Service: In past years, our class has been able to support class gatherings in various cities and modestly support community service efforts. However, we‚Äôd like to be in a financial position to be able to do more on both fronts.
  • Class dues are 100% tax deductible!

Dues Goals:

Our goal is to raise our dues participation rate and build class funds to support more class gatherings across the globe. We know you‚Äôre busy, and to make it easier, we‚Äôve launched a variety of alternative dues payment plans. In addition to a simple one-time payment, we can now set up recurring annual payments, something many have asked for over the years. In addition, you can now set up a five-year advance payment option. Under this new structure, you can pay your dues with a 20% discount for this year and the next four to come so you can cross this action item off your list (at least until our 30th rolls around)! Finally, we‚Äôve set up a one-time ‚Äúlifetime‚Äù dues plan. If you‚Äôd like, you can make a one-time payment of‚Ä¶$2,000 and never worry about dues again! So there are now four options for paying your dues this fiscal year:

Pay your dues! (requires Tigernet login)

  • Regular Dues: $50/classmate
  • Annual Dues: $50/classmate/year
  • Five Year Prepayment Regular Dues: $200/classmate
  • Lifetime Dues: $2,000/classmate
  • Catchup Dues: $50/classmate

Please consider donating at your earliest convenience and if you are unsure if you have paid your dues last year or this year, just email our treasurer.

Dues Payers Receive Priority for On-Campus Reunions Housing

The Reunions committee has been hard at work securing housing both on and off campus for our class. As a thank you to those classmates whose continued participation enables our class to operate, we will be giving classmates who have paid dues for this year and last (FY 2024-2025 and 2023-2024 respectively) priority in the on-campus housing lottery. In years past, on campus housing has been limited and oversubscribed. This year is expected to be the same. Please note: Beds will first be assigned via a lottery among all classmates who meet the dues payment requirement by December 15, 2024. If you have not paid your 2023-2024 dues yet, you will have the opportunity to pay these dues in arrears in order to qualify. Any beds not assigned in this preferential lottery will then be made available in a lottery to the rest of the class.

For more 25th Reunion Housing details, including 2000 Hotel Blocks, please visit the Housing page

Finally, our class relies on the updates you send in with your dues! Even just a line or two about a recent move, a new job or baby, or a mini-Reunion with old friends keeps our Class Notes column current and fresh with news from classmates you may not see on Facebook or other social media. All updates submitted either via snail mail or the P2000 website are read! And, of course, you can always email Morey.

Your ideas are always welcome. We hope to see you all in Tigertown this June for Reunions 2025 (May 22-25)!

item.title: jacket-sizing-tailoring
item.description: Pro-tip: If you‚Äôre thinking about getting your jacket tailored for future Reunions (you‚Äôll get them when you get to Reunions this year), it‚Äôs best to pick a size that lines up with your shoulder width, as that‚Äôs the hardest thing for a tailor to change. The shoulder width should go across your back from shoulder to shoulder, not from shoulder to the bottom of your collar and then back down.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Pro-tip: If you‚Äôre thinking about getting your jacket tailored for future Reunions (you‚Äôll get them when you get to Reunions this year), it‚Äôs best to pick a size that lines up with your shoulder width, as that‚Äôs the hardest thing for a tailor to change. The shoulder width should go across your back from shoulder to shoulder, not from shoulder to the bottom of your collar and then back down.

  • In any case, get measured using our sizing guide here. Best to have a tailor take your measurements, but anyone can help!
  • Check out our video on how to measure an existing jacket in case you want a primer!

item.title: jacket-deadline
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
• Is December 13 a real deadline?

Sadly, yes. The costumes team has to lock down the list and do a sanity check on all the orders before they submit them to the supplier. You might get an email just confirming your selection this weekend, but yeah, it‚Äôs real.

You will be able to buy a jacket after Reunions here. We think those should arrive in the fall (Oct/Nov)

item.title: wristband-requirement
item.description: Wristbands are not necessary during events such as the P-rade and Fireworks. Please note that wristbands are only required to enter Reunion headquarter sites after 5 p.m. with the exception of class-only meals.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded: Wristbands are not necessary during events such as the P-rade and Fireworks. Please note that wristbands are only required to enter Reunion headquarter sites after 5 p.m. with the exception of class-only meals.

item.title: linen-rental-location
item.description: If you pre-ordered linens (e.g. sheets, towels, blankets, and pillow) and are staying on-campus, they will be placed in your dorm room in advance of your arrival. When you depart, you will return your linen rentals to the registration table at Whitman College. Please confirm that a crew member marks your items as returned.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
• If you pre-ordered linens (e.g. sheets, towels, blankets, and pillow) and are staying on-campus, they will be placed in your dorm room in advance of your arrival. When you depart, you will return your linen rentals to the registration table at Whitman College. Please confirm that a crew member marks your items as returned.
  • As a reminder, there will be a $50 charge per set of bed linens that are not properly returned at the conclusion of the event.

item.title: jackets-multiple

item.title: housing-hotels
item.description: Here is a list of local hotels that have historically been serviced by Reunions Shuttles.
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Here is a list of local hotels that have historically been serviced by Reunions Shuttles.

Limited on-campus housing will be allocated via lottery in mid-February. Those who receive beds will be emailed, and room assignments will be distributed by University housing representatives at check-in.

For those who indicate interest in on-campus housing but do not receive beds, an email will also be sent in mid-February offering alternative housing options (the class is investigating housing at Rider College for these classmates and their guests).

item.title: registration-hours
item.dc:creator: Princeton 2000
item.content:encoded:
Registration hours are:

  • Thursday, May 22 | Noon - 11:00 pm
  • Friday, May 23 | 9:00 am - Midnight
  • Saturday, May 24 | 9:00 am - 10:00 pm

When you arrive on campus, Registration for the 25th will be in Whitman Courtyard. If you have been allotted a bed on campus, the housing check in is located at the Dillon Gym tent.
